title: Tweak right-to-left marquee motion (speed/feel) for track title

requirements.text: Adjust the right-to-left track title marquee motion so it feels slightly less aggressive: make the default scroll a bit slower and introduce a subtle pause at the loop boundary (end/start) while keeping the scroll itself smooth and continuous during movement.
acceptanceCriteria: On both the Mini Player and Now Playing screen, long track titles still scroll right-to-left only when they overflow their container.
The marquee scroll speed is noticeably slightly slower than the current default (no sudden jumps, no stutter).
There is a small, perceptible pause at the repeat point (loop boundary) so the motion feels calmer, without breaking the seamless duplicate-text marquee effect.
The existing pause/resume interactions (pointer down/up, keyboard focus + Space/Enter) continue to work as before.
If the OS/browser has prefers-reduced-motion enabled, the title does not animate (same as current behavior).

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other frontend immutablePaths.
Keep the marquee right-to-left direction and keep reduced-motion behavior and accessibility interactions intact.
nonGoals: Do not change backend behavior or data models.
Do not redesign the Mini Player or Now Playing layouts beyond the marquee motion tuning.
